com.gej.core

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.gej.core.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public abstract class Game
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is the main class for any game. You should extend this class to write a game. The games requires J2SE 1.5 or more to run. This class won't support applet mode as applets are not the target of this engine. This class uses triple buffering if available or uses double buffering. The default game template could be like this. 
     public class MyGame extends Game {
     
     public void initResources(){
         // load resources
     }
     
     public void update(long elapsedTime){
         // update the game
     }
     
     public void render(Graphics2D g){
         // render the game
     }
     
 }
    Author:
    Sri Harsha Chilakapati
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Constructs a new Game with default values. No need to use the constructor, as it is automatically called by the constructor of the sub classes.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public final void init()
        Initializes the game. Called automatically when the game starts. Users are prohibited from overriding this method as it creates the image cache and starts the game loop

      • run

        public final void run()
        Starts the game and acts as a game loop. The FPS value is calculated automatically every second and can be known by using Global.FRAMES_PER_SECOND variable.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • paint

        public final void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draw's the game. Here the triple buffering or double buffering is implemented
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • renderComponents

        public final void renderComponents(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Render's the components on this component
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics context on which we have to draw

      • componentClicked

        public void componentClicked(javax.swing.JComponent comp)
        Called when a component is added to this game. If a visible component is clicked, the component is sent as a parameter to this method.
        Parameters:
        comp - The component which is clicked

      • addComponent

        public final void addComponent(javax.swing.JComponent comp,
                int x,
                int y)
        Adds a component to the game. The component is already visible.
        Parameters:
        comp - The component to be added.
        x - The x-coordinate of the component
        y - The y-coordinate of the component

      • clearComponents

        public final void clearComponents()
        Clears all the components from this game.

      • removeComponent

        public final void removeComponent(javax.swing.JComponent comp)
        Removes the specified component from the components list The component is made inaccessible from now.
        Parameters:
        comp - The component to be removed.

      • initResources

        public void initResources()
        Initialize the resources, if any used by the game.

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Render the game. Draw all your objects etc., in this game.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context

      • update

        public void update(long elapsedTime)
        Use this method to update your game. You could check input, collision between GObjects, and move them in this method.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - The time elapsed in the current frame

      • loadImage

        Gets you image to load from the root of your jar file
        Parameters:
        name - The name of your image
        Returns:
        The loaded image.

        Get the GInput object associated with this game.
